message: I would like to invite #TN03 high school students, parents and guidance counselors to my Annual Military Service Academy Day on Saturday, April 1, 2017 at UTC in the University Center's Chattanooga Rooms.      There will be representatives at the event from the U.S. Air Force Academy, West Point, U.S. Naval Academy, U.S. Merchant Marine Academy and the U.S. Coast Guard.  For more information please contact my Academy Coordinator, Trish Mullins at 423-756-2342 or visit my website: http://1.usa.gov/1UkxTKc.
Wishing you a wonderful and healthy #NewYear!
This afternoon I was sworn in to the 115th Congress. I'm incredibly honored to continue my service to #TN03, the State of Tennessee and our great nation.
Last night I voted 'YES' on H.Res. 11 to oppose the United Nations's recent action against Israel. #IStandWithIsrael
My thoughts and prayers are with the people of #FortLauderdale.
Today is #LawEnforcementAppreciationDay.  A big thank you to the officers who serve and protect our communities!
Official head shot for the 115th Congress

I want to congratulate Donald #Trump on becoming the 45th President of the United States.  His #Inauguration is the beginning of an opportunity for cooperative, conservative governing and I’m excited to be a part of it.  Today is a new day for our nation and I am extremely optimistic about America moving in such a positive direction.
Today on #MLKDay we remember and celebrate a great man, with an even greater dream.
I had a wonderful time this morning at Alpha Phi Alpha Fraternity's Third Annual #MartinLutherKingJr Memorial Scholarship Breakfast! #TN03
Very glad I could attend the Annual Chattanooga Area Chamber of Commerce Mayors' Business Breakfast this morning. It is always great speaking with #TN03 constituents!
Joining me in Washington for #Inauguration2017?  If so, check out these helpful hints about tomorrow's events: http://bit.ly/2iNIk8c
Happy #NationalSpousesDay to my wonderful wife, Brenda!

Thank you to those participating in The March for Life today in Washington. This important event stands up for those who cannot stand up for themselves.   One of my highest priorities is to protect the unborn and I'm proud to be #ProLife.
February is #BlackHistoryMonth. Let us recognize all of the influential African-Americans who have helped shape our history.
#HappyBirthday to our iconic 40th President, Ronald Reagan!
It was an honor to participate in Savas Kyriakidis' Pinning of Rank to Lieutenant Colonel. Thank you for your incredible service to our nation! #TN03
#HappyValentinesDay to my wonderful wife, Brenda!  Although I'm in DC right now, I'm glad we got to celebrate this weekend at Ruby Falls.
I had a great time at last night's Union County Chamber of Commerce Annual Banquet. It is always wonderful speaking with local business leaders and elected officials about what's going on in #TN03!
Today we celebrate the great leadership of our nation's presidents. #PresidentsDay
Glad I could attend the Kiwanis Club of Ooltewah-Collegedale's "Nifty Fifty" celebration this afternoon!  Thank you for all you do in #TN03.

Today I was privileged to host House Committee on Appropriations - Republicans Chairman Rodney Frelinghuysen in Oak Ridge, Tennessee, so he could see firsthand the amazing work Oak Ridge National Laboratory and Y-12 National Security Complex are doing. Their work is not only important for #TN03, but our entire nation.   Thank you, Chairman for visiting our great city!

Access to computer science education is essential for student success.  Today I visited Barger Academy of Fine Arts, Howard High School and STEM High School Chattanooga to see up close the wonderful work they are doing to promote important computer skills, like coding.    A big thank you to these wonderful students, teachers and community leaders for their hard work!
Today I reintroduced my bill, the Combating Terrorist Recruitment Act. We must use every tool in our arsenal to defeat #ISIS.  Read more here: http://bit.ly/2mHsXQW
Today I presented a flag to Sharon and Dave Gilbert in honor of their 50th wedding anniversary.  Always inspiring to see such a wonderful couple. #TN03
Thanks to University of Tennessee, Knoxville Institute of Agriculture Chancellor Dr. Tim Cross for stopping by my Washington office this afternoon!
This afternoon I spoke on the Floor of the United States House of Representatives against #Obamacare, which is crumbling under its own weight. Americans deserve better.
I had a great time at the East Tennessee Development District/ETHRA Annual Meeting in Knoxville, Tennessee.   It is always a pleasure speaking about what's going on in #TN03 and across the region.
My wife, Brenda and I just stopped by the McMinn County, Tennessee Courthouse to visit with some of the wonderful employees #TN03

Thank you Jennifer Garner for coming before the House Committee on Appropriations - Republicans to testify on  early education programs.    I'm glad we agree that access to education programs like computer science is essential for student success.
Have a safe and happy #StPatricksDay!

I'm inviting any high school or middle school student who is interested in becoming a military officer to attend my Annual Military Service Academy day at the University of Tennessee at Chattanooga (UTC).   On Saturday, April 1, 2017 from 10:00am-11:30am, representatives from all of the U.S. Military Academies, members of my staff, and ROTC leadership will be there to speak about the nomination process.  Please call my Chattanooga office at 423-756-2342 for more information.

Today I had the privilege of meeting with Cody Brock.  His patriotism and love of country are amazing to see in any young person, but his Make-A-Wish America journey has deeply moved me.  Thank you for coming to visit me at the United States Capitol, I hope you enjoy the rest of your trip! #TN03
My thoughts and prayers are with the victims of today's terrible attack in London.
Today I gave a United States Capitol tour to two #TN03 student groups.  Thank you to the McMinn County, Tennessee Girls Rugby Team and the Collegedale Adventist Middle School for coming!

Today I spoke on the Floor of the United States House of Representatives to honor Oak Ridge National Laboratory's outgoing Director, Dr. Thom Mason.  Thank you for your incredible service to #ORNL and the Oak Ridge community!

It was a pleasure visiting with Dr. Thom Mason this afternoon.  He truly is a visionary scientific leader and I'm thankful for his service at Oak Ridge National Laboratory.  Best of luck with your new venture!
Thank you to all of the military representatives, students, parents and educators who came to my Annual Military Academy Day this morning at The University of Tennessee at Chattanooga! #TN03
Last night I celebrated the National Parks Conservation Association with #TN03 constituent and friend Greg Vital.
Thanks to the Tennessee Trucking Association & Foundation for stopping by my DC office today to talk about important transportation issues.

Great turnout at last night's Nuclear Cleanup Caucus meeting!    I look forward to continuing work with my colleagues on both sides of the aisle to ensure the success of our nuclear cleanup missions, not only in #TN03, but at all cleanup sites throughout the nation.

For some time I have been deeply concerned about the horrific crimes Syrian dictator Bashar al-Assad has committed against his own people.    I completely support President Donald J. Trump's crucial and necessary action to strike the Syrian airbase.  The limited missile strike showed America will not tolerate such inhumane actions.
Congratulations, Judge Gorsuch! #SCOTUS
He is risen!  #HappyEaster from my family to yours.
#GoodFriday

Last week I was in the Middle East for official business with the House Appropriations’ State, Foreign Operations  Subcommittee.    During my trip I met with many foreign heads of state including: the Prince Regent of Jordan, Lebanon LAF Commander Gen. Joseph Awn, Egyptian President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi, along with their Foreign Minister Sameh Shoukry. We discussed the importance of defeating #ISIS, the current situation in #Syria and global security overall.    I am glad I was able to get first-hand accounts from these leaders on the challenges facing the Middle East and how that impacts American policies.

I've had the privilege of speaking to many #TN03 groups the past couple days, including: the Hixson, Tennessee Kiwanis Club, the Tennessee Association of Manufacturers, and the Vision Hospitality Group, Inc.  It is always a pleasure speaking about what is going on in Washington and throughout my District!
Appreciated the invite from Howard High School to speak their baseball team!  This is their first team in 40 years and I am proud of these great student athletes! #TN03 #HustlinTigers
Glad I could stop by the Tennessee Wildlife Federation meeting last night to talk about the importance of the Second Amendment and hunting issues.  Thanks for having me!  #TN03

I was thrilled to join President Donald J. Trump today at The White House for the signing of the American First Energy Executive Order.  This will reduce our dependence on foreign energy sources, generate billions of dollars in revenues, create jobs and help to keep energy prices affordable for Americans.   Watch it here-->http://bit.ly/2ppIG9W

Thank you to the creative #TN03 students who participated in this year's Congressional Art Competition.   Also a big congratulations to Electra Lowe from Campbell County, Tennessee for winning this year's competition with her piece "Fall Away"!
Enjoyed speaking to #StrollingThunder about my work as the Co-chair of the Congressional Babies caucus and the importance of early childhood education.

For far too long #Obamacare has hurt American families by not keeping its promises. That is why I voted in favor of the #AHCA. This bill will reduce premiums, stabilize the market, and ensure patient choice.

I was proud to be a part of today's Armed Forces Day festivities as we honored our veterans and this year's recognized military branch--the United States Air Force.   A big thank you to Lt. Gen. Arnold W. Bunch Jr. (Air Force) for joining us in #TN03 for this special day!
I had a great time at yesterday's Plateau Electric Co-Op Annual Meeting in Scott County, Tennessee.  Always wonderful visiting with #TN03 constituents!

Having a great time making my way through #TN03 with events in Rocky Top and Clinton, Tennessee this afternoon.  I had the privilege of attending the official change of the Lake City Post Office to the Rocky Top Post Office and it was my pleasure to join the Clinton Rotary Club for lunch.   I also had the opportunity to speak about what is going on in Washington and my District with Ron Meredith of WYSH radio, as well as with Clinton, Tennessee Council Member and pharmacist, Jim McBride.
#HappyMothersDay to all of the incredible moms out there, including my wonderful wife, Brenda!

Today I was fortunate to meet with #TN03 students from Sharps Chapel Elementary School and Campbell County High School to talk about my job as their Congressman in Washington.   Also, I stopped by the Union County Courthouse and attended a business roundtable in Caryville, Tennessee with local officials.

Today I was honored to say a few words at the BBB Serving Southeast TN and Northwest GA's Annual Meeting. Thank you for all the wonderful work you do for #TN03.  Additionally, I met with the president of Southern Adventist University, Dr. David Smith and members of his staff.
I met with foreign exchange students participating in CIEE Study Abroad's scholarship program this afternoon.   It was interesting hearing about their time spent in the #USA and I wish them the best!

I'm proud to have been a part of yesterday's ribbon cutting dedicating SR 11, as the "Mayor Tom Rowland" interchange in Cleveland, Tennessee.   Also, I paid a visit to Polk County, Tennessee and visited with some #TN03 constituents.
The Tennessee Aquarium is celebrating 25 years! This is an amazing #Chattanooga institution and I'm so excited I could join Keith Sanford, President/CEO for a tour today.  #TN03
I had such a fun time yesterday at Jfest with my wife, Brenda! It was great talking about my work in Washington to over 5,000 people! #TN03

A big thank you to Secretary Rick Perry for visiting Oak Ridge National Laboratory and Y-12 National Security Complex today!  Glad we could share the important work we are doing in Oak Ridge, Tennessee with you! #TN03
Today on #MemorialDay we remember the brave men and women who gave their lives for our freedom.

I was honored to speak at #MemorialDay ceremonies held at the Chattanooga National Cemetery and East Ridge, Tennessee today. Thank you to our servicemen and women who have paid the ultimate price in defense of our country.

Yesterday I spoke at the Tennessee Valley Corridor's National Summit. Thank you to everyone who participated including folks from #TN03's own Oak Ridge National Laboratory and Y-12 National Security Complex.
Congratulations to Dr. Thomas Zacharia on being named the new director of Oak Ridge National Laboratory!
Praying for those affected by yesterday's heinous terror attack in London.
This afternoon I was privileged to speak at Veterans Memorial Park in celebration of our veterans who saw action during the Battle of Midway. We honor their courage and sacrifice 75 years later.
Today I said a few words at the Tennessee Association of Utility Districts' 60th Anniversary Luncheon. Thank you for everything you do for the people of Tennessee!

73 years ago today, American troops and their allies stormed the beaches of Normandy in what would be the beginning of the end for the Nazi occupation of Western Europe. We salute those who sacrificed so much that day. #DDay
This morning I participated in the groundbreaking ceremony for Erlanger Health System's new Children's Hospital Outpatient Center. I know our youth are in great hands!

Another packed house at the Nuclear Cleanup Caucus last night!  We must continue our bipartisan work to promote the awareness of our nuclear legacy and build a stronger coalition to fight for the needs of our cleanup missions in #TN03 and throughout the nation.
Looking forward to working with President Trump on streamlining the infrastructure permitting process.
I had a great time at Riverbend Festival with my wonderful wife, Brenda.

I was very sad to hear that Tom Edd Wilson passed over the weekend. Mr. Wilson was a devoted civic leader who committed his life to improving our great city. Just last week I attended an event at Erlanger Hospital where he spearheaded the effort to raise funds for the new Children's Hospital Outpatient Center. He will indeed be missed, and my thoughts and prayers are with his family.
Thank you for all the well wishes. I was at the practice when the attack occurred. I was not injured and my prayers are with the victims.
#HappyFathersDay to all the great dads out there.

I am truly humbled and thankful for the amount of support I have received since the horrific attack on Wednesday. I was fortunate to avoid injury, but two out of the five victims of this cowardly act remain in serious condition. Please keep Representative Scalise and Matt Mika in your prayers.   Also, I want to take the time to commend Capitol Police Officers Crystal Griner and David Bailey for their heroism. Without their courage under fire, many more of us would have been injured and even killed.

Tonight I joined President Donald J. Trump and Vice President Mike Pence at the 2017 White House Congressional Picnic. I presented POTUS my official baseball card and we discussed how to Make America Great Again.
Last night I had a blast at the Harry S. Truman Bowling Alley with fellow members of the House Values Action Team. Always great to bond with my colleagues who support traditional conservative values.
Yesterday I visited CHI Memorial and had the privilege to speak at Howard Roddy's retirement reception. Thank you for all your years spent dedicated to our community!
This morning I dropped by Abba's House where I was able to catch up with my good friend Mike Huckabee. #AllAmericanDay

I was saddened by the damage caused by the fire in downtown Athens over the weekend. However, Athens is more than just bricks and mortar. The people here are the best of the best and even charmed President Reagan when he visited in 1985. I am confident the City of Athens, Tennessee will come back stronger than ever.   I would also like to applaud the firefighters who contained the blaze. I was told that the damage could have been worse if it were not for their swift actions.
I hope everyone has a safe and happy #July4th! #USA
Yesterday I had a fantastic time joining constituents in Hamilton County for #4thofJuly celebrations a day early. I am always impressed by the patriotism on display!

Covered a lot of ground in #TN03 today. Highlights included visiting with folks at Smokin' the Water in Kingston and at #July4th celebrations in Soddy Daisy and Sweetwater. We then ended our day with the great people of Tiftonia/Lookout Valley.

This morning I joined Bill Haslam, Kellyanne Conway, and HHS Secretary Tom Price, M.D. for a roundtable discussion about the opioid and heroin crisis that is devastating parts of this country including East Tennessee. As a member of the Congressional Bipartisan Task Force to Combat the Heroin Epidemic, I am committed to eradicating the scourge that is opioid and heroin addiction.

Today I attended the Bradley County Sheriff's picnic to congratulate them on their tremendous total offense clearance rate for 2016. Between 2006 and 2016 the BCSO increased their clearance rate from 45 percent to 65 percent which is good for number one in Tennessee for counties with over 100,000 residents. I know the citizens of Bradley County sleep easier at night knowing they have these fine men and women protecting them. Law enforcement officers put their lives on the line for us every day and deserve our respect and admiration. God bless the thin blue line!

Yesterday I had the pleasure of visiting with Lela Moody, a patient at St. Jude Children's Research Hospital and one of the bravest 5 year olds I know. I am so glad to learn that she is doing well, and her visit brightened my day!

This morning I participated in the Chattanooga Heroes Run / Walk to honor the 5 victims of the 2015 Chattanooga shootings. Today we remember Gunnery Sgt. Thomas J. Sullivan, Lance Cpl. Squire K. Wells, Sgt. Carson A. Holmquist, Staff Sgt. David A. Wyatt, and Petty Officer 2nd Class Randall Smith. We will never forget them.
After the event this morning, I attended a memorial service at the Chattanooga National Cemetery for the 5 victims. We will always be #ChattanoogaStrong

Last night I was honored to speak at the Chattanooga Strong Community Concert marking the two year anniversary of the Chattanooga shootings. We must always remember those who would risk their lives for our freedoms. #ChattanoogaStrong

I am proud to recognize the Chattanooga Area Chamber of Commerce for winning the 2017 Chamber of the Year Award for midsize cities. The Chamber of the Year Award highlights the leadership role chambers play to improve businesses and communities. Congratulations to the Chamber’s President Bill Kilbride, board members, and local businesses who worked in unison to make #Chattanooga the 2017 Chamber of the Year.

I would like to extend my thoughts and prayers to Senator John McCain and his family. From his distinguished service in Vietnam to serving the state of Arizona, the Senator has dedicated his life to public service. No matter your political views, he is a great American and I ask all of you to pray for his health, wellness, and recovery.

This morning I had the privilege to speak at the Microsoft Innovation & Policy Center to discuss the importance of computer science literacy in today’s classrooms. It is no secret that technology plays a large role in education, and I thank Microsoft for their invitation and riveting discussion regarding what can be done to fill the demand for computing jobs in our classrooms across the country.

The swift action of five police officers on the morning of June 14, 2017 was recognized today as they were awarded the Medal of Valor. These individuals are shining examples of heroes to the highest degree.   https://fleischmann.house.gov/media/press-releases/release-fleischmann-attends-medal-valor-presentation-congressional-baseball

Sky high at 220 ft., the structural test stand is an integral part of the Space Launch System currently being derived by the minds at NASA. This stand will test the durability of liquid hydrogen fuel tanks that will support the most powerful rocket to date for space travel and exploration. Thank you to the kind folks at NASA's Marshall Space Flight Center for the insightful tour of this world renowned technology. #NASA #SLS

Greatly enjoyed my conversation with Vice President Mike Pence last night. We discussed plans for Tennessee now and in the future. Thank you for your leadership, Mr. Vice President. I am excited for the work that lies ahead.

This morning I had the pleasure to join the local community in celebration of Hamilton Place's 30th Anniversary. Since 1987, Hamilton Place has generated economic growth and provided jobs to residents of #TN03. There is no better way to start my day than interacting with constituents, speaking with Mayor Andy Berke and Mayor Jim Coppinger, and celebrating Hamilton Place.

Thank you to Cindy's Choice and NoogaRadio 92.7 FM - AM 1240 for having me on their broadcast this afternoon. I was delighted to join my friends Stefanie Crowe and Cindy Cole Deering to speak about my personal and professional experiences with small businesses, and the critical role women entrepreneurs play in advancing the economy.

I was honored to be a keynote speaker at the Tennessee Farm Bureau Federation's Presidents Conference. We discussed state-wide issues that affect all 95 Tennessee counties, and I was able to answer additional questions in the Q&A that followed. I am glad to support agriculture in the great state of #Tennessee, and happy to protect our hardworking farmers. #TNFBpres17

Did you know recreational boating brings billions of dollars to the U.S. economy? Today, I met with leaders from local, state, and federal government along with educators from Cleveland State Community College and #TN03 located businesses, like MasterCraft Boat Company, to talk about workforce development. I am committed to making sure that we are providing young people with the necessary tools and education to take advantage of the many job opportunities in East Tennessee.
In case you missed it, I recently spoke to WTVC-TV NewsChannel 9 News about the violence in Charlottesville, Virginia. Messages of hate must be condemned.
In case you missed it, I recently spoke to WTVC-TV NewsChannel 9 News about the violence in Charlottesville, Virginia. Messages of hate must be condemned.

It has been a couple of busy, yet productive, days in East Tennessee. I was able to speak to the ladies and gentlemen of the Kiwanis Club of Chattanooga and host a business round table at the Tennessee College of Applied Technology Oneida/Huntsville. At both of these events, conversations ranged from accomplishments of congress to issues of local and national importance. What I appreciated most was the insight and input expressed to me of how we can continue to move #TN03 in the right direction.

If you live in Morgan County you have likely visited the Nemo Bridge. For years, the iconic bridge has been in need of rehabilitation and repairs. Yesterday, I was able to accompany Deputy Commissioner Brock Hill and others to celebrate the grant of $1 million from the Federal Highway Administration and additional generous donations that will allow residents to enjoy this landmark in a restored, beautiful state.

Thank you to the Campbell County Chamber of Commerce - Campbell County, TN for the allowing me to accompany them during breakfast. I was able to catch up with my friend and Campbell County Mayor, E.L. Morton. During breakfast, Ben Sterling spoke about his work with TN Promise. Tennessee Promise is a scholarship program that supplements the tuition costs for two years to students who attend a community or technical college. Programs like TN Promise that strengthen our communities while contributing to #workforce development is one of the many reasons I am so proud to represent the Third District.

Since 1992 Cooper Container has called Union County, Tennessee home. Once a small business owner myself, I recognize the immense work ethic A.C. and Donnie Cooper demonstrate 24/7 to create such success. In addition to transforming sheets to boxes companies use to ship goods, Cooper Container partners with the local high school to instill work ethic in young adults. Thank you for the tour and your remarkable work, gentlemen.

The county crusade continued in Roane County. Roane County is a vibrant community and that does not happen by chance, but is a result of hard work. The highlights of my visit included fielding questions from concerned #Tennesseans in Kingston, Tennessee, Oliver Springs, Tennessee, and Harriman, Tennessee. In between cities, I was able to tour the Roane County Courthouse. Thank you to Roane County Executive, Ron Woody, for taking the time out of your schedule to give me a tour. There was also talk about the high school football game tonight, good luck to Kingston High School (Tennessee) and Harriman High School!

The results of war and combat have life long impacts on both those who served as well as their friends and families. The assistance and friendship provided by Friends of Gold Star Wives to those who have lost a spouse to a military-related cause of death is an inspirational feat. I was able to take part in the landmark occasion by presenting a congressional certificate to the #Magnolia Chapter in recognition of their 10 year anniversary this weekend. Thank you to all you provide to those who have endured the ultimate sacrifice and God Bless America.
It is imperative that we foster positive relations with Afghanistan, and work in unison with the Afghan troops to assure that the Taliban never regains the slightest momentum in the ascent to power.

Thank you Military Officers Association of America (MOAA) for the invitation to be a keynote speaker last night. It was an honor and privilege to share a room with an organization that remains devoted to the selfless cause of ensuring those who have served our country are able to enjoy to the best possible life after service. From career transition to spouse #development and community outreach, keep up the admirable work.

When great minds come together amazing things happen. That was the premise of the reception I attended today put on by The Company Lab and 1 Million Cups Chattanooga. Dr. Thomas Zacharia, Laboratory Director at Oak Ridge National Laboratory, spoke about ways entrepreneurs can partner with the innovative minds at #ORNL to create groundbreaking technologies. Dr. Zacharia is an outstanding leader that I am thrilled to have at #ORNL and in #TN03.

An organization of 214 Tennessee banks, thrift institutions, and trust companies, the Tennessee Bankers Association is a prime example of why Tennessee is the business metropolis we know today. Thank you for the kind invitation to your meeting and the fundamental role you play in numerous #Tennessee communities.

I was humbled to have received the Spirit of Enterprise Award from the U.S. Chamber of Commerce. My commitment to pro-job policies remains a cornerstone of my role to represent the Third District of Tennessee. Thank you to the U.S. Chamber of Commerce for the award and recognition.

Today, I was excited to join in the celebration of the Fifth Anniversary of the Women’s Entrepreneurs Symposium. Each year,  WE Women Entrepreneurs continues to grow as they fulfill their mission to "turn passions for purpose into successful, impactful organizations." This year, the festivities included panel discussions, breakout sessions, and an insightful speech from Ms. Joan Cronan. Thank you for the continued opportunity to be honorary Chairman. To all those who put on this spectacular event, congratulations on a job well done! #WeRockCHA

In case you missed it, I spoke to WATE-TV 's Drew Petrimoulx about the tragedy that Harvey caused in Texas. Thank you to the compassionate individuals and organizations offering shelter and assistance to those in peril. Texans, Tennessee stands with you and we pray for you. The storm is how heading for Louisiana, please take proper safety precautions against this horrific natural disaster.

My response to the President's Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals, or DACA, decision. The 6-month delay will provide Congress with the proper time necessary to craft legislation to address the immigration issues facing our nation.
I was honored to support legislation providing the desperately needed $7.85 billion in disaster relief funding to our good friends in Texas.
NA
Let us never forget September 11, 2001. God Bless America.

It is always my pleasure to meet with our nation’s veterans. We discussed ways to ensure our troops have the assets they need to combat the issues facing the modern world, and how to improve the care and support our veterans receive.

This morning, I was honored to speak at the #2017 U.S. Department of Energy National Cleanup Workshop. The relationship between the U.S. Department of Energy , local government, and the House Nuclear Cleanup Caucus is fundamental to our joint mission to address environmental cleanup issues across the United States. As Chairman of the House Nuclear Cleanup Caucus, I look forward to working hand in hand to advance this mission.

Tonight I attended my second nuclear cleanup focused event of the day. We broke a record with the highest event attendance yet. Thank you to Energy Facility Contractors Group - EFCOG, Energy, Technology & Environmental Business Association, and the Nuclear Energy Institute for orchestrating this informative event.
Today, the House moved quickly to fund essential government operations in one of the most conservative appropriations packages to pass the House of Representatives in recent years.

As the first recycled paperboard mill in the southern United States, WestRock Chattanooga Mill has always been a unique business in #TN03. Today, the mill celebrates 100 years in the Chattanooga community. Happy anniversary WestRock Chattanooga Mill, and thank you for the tour!

There is no better way to start a Saturday than by speaking for a great cause. The annual Walk to End Alzheimer’s raised over $12,000 with over 1,000 participants. Together, we can end #Alzheimer's disease.

Chattanooga, Tennessee would not be the city it is today without the leadership of individuals like Councilwoman Coonrod. Her passion and dedication to the Ninth District of #Chattanooga is inspiring, and I greatly enjoyed meeting with her this morning. Thank you for your service!

This morning, I had the privilege to present Mr. Bob Doak, #Chattanooga Convention and Visitors Bureau President and CEO, with a congressional certificate for his outstanding work in the tourism and hospitality industry at the 76th Annual Chattanooga Convention Visitors Bureau Meeting. After 35 years in the industry, Mr. Doak will be retiring. The event brought together an array of individuals including civic leaders, county commissioners, and elected officials all of which I was pleased to visit with and discuss ways to advance our local communities. #Congratulations on your retirement, Mr. Doak!

Today I joined fellow members of the #Tennessee Delegation to celebrate the culmination of many hours of hard work in an exciting project unveiled by EPB in partnership with the U.S. Department of Energy and national laboratories from across the nation, including Oak Ridge. The Grid Modernization Lab Consortium (GMLC) program will present the opportunity to enhance our power distribution infrastructure to benefit people in hometown communities while advancing a national effort to modernize the grid.  Specifically, this battery storage pilot project will aim to reduce the impact of power outages while also addressing the issue of higher power demand from many areas including families in #TN03.

I spent my Saturday up in Scott County, Tennessee partaking in the #Brimstone Paragon. I greatly enjoy this event because it allows me time to visit with constituents, enjoy live music, and explore the beautiful Tennessee landscape.

Every year my wife, Brenda, and I look forward to attending the Hamilton County, TN Fair at Chester Frost Park. I appreciate the opportunity to meet with friends and families from Hamilton County and all over #TN03.
Today I was honored to recognize a hardworking group of #TSA employees for 15 years of service. Thank you for all you do to ensure that travelers arrive to their destinations safely.

September is Rheumatic Disease Awareness Month. I was happy to meet with doctors and patients from Tennessee to discuss early intervention and treatment methods to improve the quality of life for individuals living with rheumatic diseases. #RDAM

Students and instructors in the SkillsUSA program from Tennessee College of Applied Technology - Chattanooga and Tennessee College of Applied Technology - Jacksboro came by to discuss the importance of technical education and training for #workforce development. I am proud to see programs like this thrive in the Third District of Tennessee.
Happy 31st wedding anniversary to my lovely wife, Brenda. I am so thankful to have spent these last 31 years with you, and I look forward to many more.
I support #prolife legislation and proudly cosponsored H.R. 490, the Heartbeat Bill. Thank you Faith2Action for coming by this afternoon to present me with the “Heartbeat Bill Hero” award.
American families and companies should no longer be stifled by a tax code that is outdated and overcomplicated.

Did you know September is Prostate Cancer Awareness Month? Thank you Chattanoogan.com for publishing my wife, Brenda’s, article that provides information about prostate cancer, proper detection methods, and reminds us all to prioritize #health and well-being in our daily lives.

This morning, my heart goes out to the city of Las Vegas. As I monitor the situation, I am devastated by the senseless act of violence that occurred last night as Americans came together to attend a concert. I thank the selfless and quick efforts of first responders and emergency personnel. I pray for all affected by this horrible tragedy, and hope to know a day when these heartless actions cease to exist.

Last night, I enjoyed dinner at the Italian Ambassador’s residence with my wife, Brenda, Kellyanne Conway, and colleagues from both sides of the aisle to honor the #Italian American Congressional Delegation of the 115th Congress. Thank you to the Ambassador of Italy and Mrs. Armando Varricchio for the invitation and a wonderful evening.

Since 2007, HonorAir Knoxville recognizes the service of #Tennessee’s veterans from War War II, Korean, and Vietnam Wars with a visit to our Nation’s Capital to see the memorials established in their honor. Today, I was humbled to join these American heroes in a wreath-laying ceremony at the Air Force Memorial. To every veteran that I met today, and all who served our country, thank you for your service.

As the U.S. Virgin Islands recover from the destruction caused by hurricanes Irma and Maria, the dedication of men and women from #TN03, and across Tennessee, show the true colors of the Volunteer State. It is undeniable that the road to recovery from these natural disasters is long, but I believe through the humanitarian efforts highlighted in this article progress can be made toward restoration of the U.S. Virgin Islands.

Today, the House passed a conservative budget that will open the door to massive relief for families in Tennessee struggling with the broken tax code while also addressing the status quo of wasteful deficit spending.

I was happy to welcome House Armed Services Committee Chairman Mac Thornberry to Oak Ridge, Tennessee to visit Y-12 National Security Complex and Oak Ridge National Laboratory.  Follow the link to find out more about our visit: https://fleischmann.house.gov/media/press-releases/release-fleischmann-thornberry-visit-y-12-national-security-complex-and-oak

From Staff:  Happy Birthday, Boss! Thank you for showing us the qualities of a leader, and for your constant encouragement. We are thankful for you, and can't wait to cheer you on at the Congressional Football Game For Charity tonight!

For 40 years the U.S. Department of Energy has worked to ensure the future of #America through their focus on energy, environmental, and nuclear issues. It was my pleasure to join Secretary Rick Perry and my colleagues in the House to wish the U.S. Department of Energy a happy birthday!

This afternoon the U.S. House of Representatives passed my bill, H.R. 378, the Bonuses for Cost-Cutters Act of 2017. This bill gives incentives for employees to report the waste, fraud, and abuse of federal dollars. Watch my Floor speech here:

Do you believe good deeds deserve to be rewarded? I do.  The House #passed my bill, H.R. 378, the Bonuses for Cost-Cutters Act of 2017. This bill aims to stop the trend of wasteful spending, reward employees, and save the federal government money.

Last night I joined NFL alumni, fellow members of Congress, and the U.S. Capitol Police for the Congressional Football Game For Charity. The event included a halftime presentation with Congressman Steve Scalise to honor the heroism of Capitol Police special agent David Bailey and special agent Crystal Griner for their actions during the June 14 tragedy. This game is truly a unique experience benefiting several worthy causes, and I look forward to taking the field to participate every year.

In recent months, wildfires and hurricanes have wreaked havoc on America. Today, the House passed an additional $36.5 billion in emergency supplemental funding to combat the wildfires plaguing California, aid the residents of Puerto Rico, and help families continue to recover from the damage and destruction of hurricane-related flooding.

Today I joined American Cancer Society Making Strides Against Breast Cancer in the fight against breast cancer. Nearly 250,000 people will be diagnosed with breast cancer this year, and every diagnosis is one too many. Thank you to everyone who came out to show their #support and raise money for #research and #awareness.

It is always exciting to see progress and development in #TN03. Today, I had the pleasure of touring the Air Traffic Control Center at Chattanooga Airport to learn about their advancements in equipment and the impact they are having on air travel in East Tennessee.

Last night, my wife and I joined our University of Tennessee, Knoxville alumni family at an event in #Chattanooga. We are so proud of the University of Tennessee system, and the endless  opportunities an excellent education provides for our young men and women. I was also happy to visit with former head football coach Phillip Fulmer. Go Vols!

My wife and I recently had the privilege to participate in the  American Cancer Society Making Strides Against Breast Cancer walk. Breast cancer has had a personal impact on my life, and I hope you to take the time to read my wife’s article and share the information with your loved ones. Together we can help to prevent breast cancer.

This afternoon I joined the The University of Tennessee at Chattanooga Mocs for Military Appreciation Day. Our men and women in uniform make immense sacrifices on behalf of our country, and I was happy to visit with friends, cheer on the #Mocs, and thank our military for all they do.
It is clear Iran is a belligerent actor in global politics seeking to destabilize the region for their own power and advance their perverse ideology.

Today, President Trump declared the opioid epidemic a public health emergency, bringing badly needed additional federal resources to combat a crisis that has had a dire effect on Tennessee. In 2016 alone, over 1,186 Tennesseans lost their lives to opioid overdose. To put that in perspective, that is 18 out of every 100,000 people.

Last night, I visited Oak Ridge to join in the celebration of the 2017 St Marys Fall Festival. For 67 years, the #festival has been a staple in the local community. Thank you to everyone who has organized this wonderful event over the years.

In 2011, a tragic tornado struck the Apison and Cherokee Valley communities taking the lives of 15 individuals. Sadly, the original memorial site and monument were destroyed in June 2016. Over the past year, the communities came together to ensure that the lives of the individuals continue to be remembered and honored with a restoration of the Apison Cherokee Valley Tornado Memorial. I was humbled to present a flag flown over the United States Capitol in remembrance of the lives that were lost in 2011 at the rededication ceremony. The Apison-Cherokee Valley Memorial Monument is located at the Apison Fire Station and serves as a symbol of resilient communities that will forever remember the 15 individuals who lost their lives in the devastating tornado.

This morning, I delivered opening remarks at the Tennessee Valley Corridor Leadership Council Roundtable. The purpose of Tennessee Valley Corridor to sustain current federal missions and compete for new missions to grow private sector jobs continues to be important to the development of Chattanooga and throughout #TN03. Thank you to all the panelists that attended and contributed to the discussion about the future of partnerships in the entrepreneurial and innovation communities.

It was my pleasure to meet with President Cordano of  Gallaudet University this afternoon. Our discussion included measures that can be taken to ensure hearing impaired children have the ability to communicate properly. As co-chair of the Baby Caucus, I am dedicated to this mission, and I thank Ms. Cordano for her work and partnership with this cause.
Today, the Committee on Ways and Means released the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act. Click below to read more and learn how this tax plan affects families and businesses in #TN03:
Last night was a wonderful night in Roane County with the celebration of the annual Roane Alliance Gala. I enjoyed visiting with friends and neighbors from Roane County and across #Tennessee.

Please join me in praying for the city of Sutherland Springs, Texas, and all who are suffering after the horrible shooting at First Baptist Church of Sutherland Springs. Tonight, my heart is with Texas and the victims of this tragedy.

This weekend I joined the #Collegedale community in celebration of the grand opening of The Commons and Christmas Tree Lighting. Congratulations to city leaders, the Collegedale Tomorrow Foundation Inc., and the entire community on the opening of this wonderful facility.

This afternoon I was privileged to speak on a panel at the Israeli-American Coalition for Action Conference alongside Representative Brad Schneider and Representative Ted Deutch. The video below captures one of the many topics discussed and highlights my thoughts regarding the importance of the U.S. – Israeli Alliance.

The House just passed H.R. 3411, the Save Local Business Act. Read more about this legislation that benefits small business →   The cornerstone of a successful small business is the relationship between the employers and employees. H.R. 3441, the Save Local Business Act, will restore that relationship by clarifying the definition of the “joint-employer” standard through removal of burdensome regulations unfairly thrust upon small businesses by the National Labor Relations Board (NLRB) in 2015. If left in place, the liability issues resulting from this Obama-Era definition could result in the loss of 1.7 million jobs. Small businesses are the backbone of our country and our economy, and that is why I supported H.R. 3441. This legislation is critical to promoting the entrepreneurial spirit that drives our economy, not crushing it with overbearing regulations and far-reaching definitions.

Living in the United States, we have many things to be proud of, but first and foremost are the freedoms we enjoy daily. The foundational liberties laid out in the Constitution and Bill of Rights are what makes our country so great. Today, we honor the men and women who donned our country’s uniform and risked their lives to defend those freedoms, to protect our communities, and safeguard the promise of a brighter tomorrow. Today I am especially proud to represent a state with such a rich history of respect for and service to our country.  Beginning with the War of 1812, thousands of Tennessee soldiers volunteered to defend our country and fight for freedom. During the Mexican-American War, Tennesseans once again showed their dedication to our nation far surpassing then-Governor Aaron Brown’s request for 2,600 volunteers as 30,000 Tennesseans responded to the call of duty. Throughout history, such repeated actions earned Tennessee the slogan: ‘the Volunteer State’. To every Volunteer past and present, who inspire the volunteers of the future, thank you for your service to our great nation, and Happy Veterans Day.

Beginning my #Veterans Day Weekend in Collegedale at the Veterans Day service. This weekend, I look forward to attending events to honor and recognize veterans for their sacrifice and service to our country.

This morning, I was humbled to join veterans, friends, and families of the #Chattanooga community for their Veterans Day program. I am thankful to have had the privilege to hear the stories of triumph and sacrifice from veterans in #TN03, and thank them for their service to our nation.

Thank you to President David Smith, Ben Wygal, Professor Martin, and the students at Southern Adventist University for the warm welcome to their campus. It was my pleasure to speak with students interested in government, and I hope they continue to excel in their studies in the years ahead.

Thank you President Donald J. Trump for coming to #Capitol Hill to discuss today's monumental vote on H.R. 1, the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act. Finally, Americans will have long-awaited, #fair, #simple tax reform.
Today, the House of Representatives passed H.R.1, the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act.This legislation benefits East Tennessee families, businesses, and leads to a more prosperous Volunteer State.

I joined Rep. Diane Black, Marsha Blackburn, and fellow #Tennesseans for the 24th Annual #Chili Supper sponsored by State Senator Ken Yager. I hope all who attended warmed up with some chili in support of a great cause, the Roane Free Medical Clinic.
This morning my wife and I had a wonderful time visiting with residents of #TN03 during the Hoho Expo at the Chattanooga Convention Center.

Today, I joined Deputy Secretary of Energy Dan Brouillette and Senator Lamar Alexander for a groundbreaking ceremony for Outfall 200, the new Mercury Treatment Facility at Y-12 National Security Complex. The remediation of mercury contamination there will pave the way for further cleanup work, such as the demolition of contaminated buildings. I’m proud of the work done to date and will continue to advocate to ensure that those on the front lines have resources necessary to succeed.

Yesterday was a big day in Oak Ridge, Tennessee. The second event of the day was the ribbon cutting for the Uranium Processing Facility’s Construction Support Building. This event marked an important milestone in the Uranium Processing Facility (UPF) project, which will replace an early-Cold War facility with a modern one capable of efficiently and safely carrying out operations vital to our nation’s nuclear security. I applaud the efforts of the many people working to keep this project on time and on budget, and I reaffirm my commitment to support those efforts and fund this facility through completion.

So happy to see Y-12 National Security Complex Historian D. Ray Smith honored with the U.S. Department of Energy Gold Medal Award. Having given more than 48 years to Y-12 and its mission, I cannot think of a better person to receive this award. Congratulations!
From my family to yours, I wish you a very blessed and happy Thanksgiving.

The commitment of The Salvation Army USA to provide assistance to those in need helps millions of individuals and families each year. Yesterday, I met with members of the organization to discuss the latest legislation in Washington and, most importantly, thank them for their service to communities in #TN03.

Lung cancer will claim thousands of lives each year, but one of the best ways to fight cancer is to be informed. In case you missed it, my wife addressed ways to prevent lung cancer, symptoms of lung cancer, and much more in this article published by Chattanoogan.com.

My Saturday consisted of attending the MAINX24 Annual #Pancake Breakfast where I was able to visit with East #Tennesseans. The best part of the event was the proceeds benefit the Forgotten Child Fund, an amazing organization with roots right here in #TN03.  Next, I was able to speak at the Robotics Competition welcoming over 800 students, parents, and teachers, and congratulating students on their accomplishments. Thank you to the sponsors of the event for creating a fun and educational experience that reinforces the idea that hard work pays off.
My wife and I had a wonderful time at the White House Christmas Party last night.
Today, President Donald J. Trump made a historic announcement to recognize #Jerusalem as the capital of #Israel. Read my full statement:

For far too long law-abiding gun owners have had to navigate a treacherous and ever shifting labyrinth of local and state gun laws while traveling with their concealed carry permits. The House just passed H.R. 38, the Concealed Carry Reciprocity Act, which protects your Second Amendment rights.

America is the greatest country on Earth, but history reminds us of threats to our great nation. Today we remember Pearl Harbor, a tragic attack on our values, our freedom, and our country. I would like to take a moment to honor those who risk their lives every day, and remember those who lost their lives on December 7, 1941.

As we begin to enjoy the holidays with friends and family, we must remember that not all get to celebrate with their loved ones. This afternoon, it was my honor to participate in the  American Red Cross Holiday Mail for Heroes signing event. I am eternally grateful to the service members, veterans, and their families that sacrifice so much to give us the best present of all, freedom.

After 5 years of construction, I was happy to attend the ribbon cutting ceremony for SpringHill Suites. This hotel complex will be a great addition to the local community. Congratulations to all who put in years of hard work on the completion of this successful project.

Last night, on the third night of #Hanukkah, I was privileged to partake in the Menorah Lighting ceremony. Thank you to Rabbi Pearlstein and the Jewish community for allowing me to join you for this special Hanukkah tradition. Happy Hanukkah to all who are celebrating!

Today, around the nation, volunteers lay wreaths to pay respect to the courage, strength, and selflessness of America’s Armed Forces. I was honored to participate in the Wreaths Across America service at Chattanooga National Cemetery. We would not be here without the commitment of our men and women in uniform to our country, and for that, I am incredibly thankful.

Across the United States there are an increasing number of job openings with state-of-the-art technology that require specialized technical training. However, I constantly speak to employers who voice concern that our workforce supply cannot meet this demand.Today, I spoke on the Floor of the U.S. House of Representatives to express my support for #workforce development and the use of public-private partnerships to bring computer science education to more K-12 classrooms. WATCH →

With a vote of 227-203, the House passed the Conference Report to Accompany H.R.1, The Tax Cuts and Jobs Act. The last time Americans witnessed tax reform was 1986, and I am proud to have voted to change that today. Read more:
It's official- H.R. 1, The Tax Cuts and Jobs Act is on the way to President Donald J. Trump's desk!

Wildfires continue to burn hundreds of thousands of acres across the Californian terrain, and the results of relentless flooding from storms Harvey, Irma, and Maria reduced neighborhoods throughout Texas and the southern United States to ruins, leaving Americans with no place to call home this holiday season. This is a heartbreaking reality for thousands of families. Today, the House passed legislation to help those in need. My full statement:

In closing 2017, my wife shared her advice on balancing this busy holiday season and maintaining a healthy lifestyle. You can read more by clicking this link:  https://fleischmann.house.gov/media/press-releases/op-ed-recipe-healthy-holidays

“For to us a child is born, to us a son is given, and the government will be on his shoulders. And he will be called Wonderful Counselor, Mighty God, Everlasting Father, Prince of Peace.” Isaiah 9:6   Today we rejoice. We rejoice with family and friends, we rejoice for our blessings this past year, for the safety of our country, for the gift of life, but most of all we rejoice that on this day, our Savior was born.   In 2017 there were many challenges, opportunities for the growth and prosperity of our nation, to give back, and to continue to find grace and humility. Let us pray for the safety of our men and women overseas, for their return, and for the families that will have an empty seat around the dinner table this Christmas. May we start each day with a gracious heart and boundless compassion for those who are less fortunate, and may you all have a very Merry Christmas.

This year the House has been hard at work, but you may not have heard about all of it.   Here’s what has been accomplished:  544 bills have PASSED out of committee → that’s 52 more than Obama’s first term and 132 more than average.   477 bills have PASSED the House → that’s 53 more than Obama’s first term and 86 more than average.  Learn more: http://didyouknow.gop/
It was my honor to serve the Third District of Tennessee in 2017. I wish you a 2018 filled with great success and many blessings- Happy New Year!
